comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of April 28, 1914, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0916FF3C5E13738... GALVESTON, Texas, April 27. Paragraph near the end includes: "A forty-foot launch came into port to-night carrying several Americans who made their escape from Tampico and braved 465 miles of open Gulf between Galveston and the Panuco River in the open boat. The refugees were employes [sic] of an American dredging company, working near Tampico." The launch is in the next photo:

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks so much, swanq, for providing the link, and connecting the images around this event.  We'll fill in some of the missing information the next time we update the records.
